Replies.Reply: Probably be in the bigs in another year.

Must be something to have that kind of talent. He's just a kid, nineteen, twenty tops, and if he stays healthy and he stays focused, the world is his oyster. Guys like you and me, we squandered those opportunities long ago.
You knew where you were going?
The only thing I knew for certain was that I would run to the corner store every day for beer.
I thought I did grow up...
My direction is east. I parked in the deck.
We're always going in different directions.
Family, my man. Take time off for a ballgame ya should probably tend to the family too. You should try it sometime.
What the hell? Officer Two spins Rick to face him.
A little? He represents your force?
I am, but I'm not sure it was responsible.
How can you be sure it was me?
My ex, Cindy, what about her responsibilities to the children?
I can't do this alone. Don't make me do this alone. I'll never make it...
Come here guys. I want to talk to you. The boys gather round.
I don't know when we're going to see your mom again.
She's kind of mad at daddy.
No, baby, not at all. Your mom needs time to work through some things. So, for awhile, it's just going to be us...
To figure out who she is, where she's going, what she wants.
She misses you too, baby. And this isn't permanent... we're going to fight this... we're going to appeal. We'll take it to the Supreme Court if we have to.
Of course I want you. I just don't think I should have to do this alone.
I know, but what's done is done.
Watch the kids one night? I could use some time to myself.
It's home and it's stable. The one thing the boys need right now is stability.
It's been five days, mom. I'm not hiding. I just need time to adjust.
No, you seemed to cover everything.
Get those seat belts on. The kids reluctantly comply.
Didn't they feed you? They said they would feed you. The brochure said meals provided.
Thirteen hours a day doesn't leave me much time for my kids, But a job's a job, right?
I give you sixty-five hours of my time and you give me two hundred fifty bucks?
I'm sorry, I'm clueless. My wife handled the checks.
Does it help that I know Frank Ryan? He told me to mention his name.
Big boys go potty on the potty, Nicholas. Nicholas go potty on the potty?
You're brothers go potty on the potty. Daddy goes potty on the potty. Nicholas go potty on the potty?
Daddy will buy Nicky a toy from the store.
If Nicky goes potty on the potty.
I know and I'm working on that.
He's going to be fine. They're working on him now. From what they told me it's just a few stitches.
I need you to be a good boy, okay?
So, did you have fun today.
Did you play with all your friends?
That's a big people word. You're a little people, and little people don't use big people words.
I don't think I have any.
I'm not even responsible for myself. How am I suppose to raise three kids?
I'll just ask God to watch them. He never abandons his children.
I don't want your money mom.
Would you do it for a nickel?
Daddy go potty in the potty.
Oh, right, I'm glad you could...
I was just demonstrating the art of...

Not criticizing, just surprised. I don't believe anyone at their old day-care had kids. If they did they kept them in a closet and only brought them out on special occasions. Christmas, Easter, an occasional birthday, and maybe when they had friends over for dinner, but only as a status symbol. It was like they'd say, "Here's the white picket fence. Here's the SUV.
You got me there. I am old.
Older than dirt. When I was a kid we didn't have dirt. We had rocks and we had hammers. If we wanted dirt we banged a few rocks with really big hammers, and then we had dirt.
This is Kristian. This is Phillip, and the little guy from the potty, is Nicholas. Guys, this is Zach and...
I'll have to try that. So, any questions about the job? Melanie moves towards the boys.
You have a real knack there.
Whatever it is, I've never seen them take to a woman like that.
I know I haven't known you very long, but I there's something I need to say...
Yeah, it was good... kinda okay...
Why can't I find a woman like you?
I feel bad for the boys. They don't have a "mom". She'll always be their mother, but she'll never be their mom.
I suppose. I don't know if you'd call it direction, but there's a definite sense of purpose.
Yeah, but is it good for the kids?
Only two kinds of people make it in this world, boy; Those that are smart and those that are strong. If you don't want to be smart and do your homework then you can be strong and do pushups.
I'm probably not as demanding of them as I should be.
... move the hell out of my house.
Ya gotta let them be what they're going to be.
And you do this with your kids?
It's a struggle, going at it alone, but...
It does have its advantages, I suppose.
He went to grab a couple beers.
Carrie, I don't even have the funds to buy my own beer.
I thank you for everything, but it's time to move on.
I don't know, Frank, but I'm worth more than this.
We're not going to fight over the bathroom.
I took off work to be here.
I don't think that's a good idea.
You think they even know who you are?
Come on guys. Someone is here to see you.
What about the boys? What about me?

You think this is easy? You think raising these boys is something I want to do alone? Every day is like a prison sentence. Every thing I do, every decision I make is directly affected by the boundaries of my responsibility. I have three children, but I have no me.
They stare at me, and I know what they're thinking...
Give your Mom a hug, guys, then get in the house.
I could have told you that.
At whose expense? Huh, Cindy? At whose expense? Who's going to dry their tears tomorrow when they realize your never coming back?
Don't you yell! If you have something to say, come here and tell me.
What were you doing in there?
Come on guys we're out of here.
I'm sorry, I made a mistake.
Can I get some help here.
It's not worth a lot, maybe a few hundred bucks, but it might keep you in soap for a year.
I didn't mean it like that?
I'm sorry, I'm going to have to reschedule.
Mom, I have an idea, but I need your help.
Put your checkbook away. What I need you can't buy.
For you to believe in me.
Well, guys, I guess this is it.
No buts: Put the stone down.
I knew this was a hard climb, but...
We're not stopping. We're just resting.
I know if I have to, I can do this alone, but do I have to do this alone? A hushed MURMUR rises in the audience. The Judge RAPS his gavel on the bench.

I have. I have laid my heart out on the line time and time again, only to walk away empty handed. This love, this caring, this sharing of life, it's a sentence and my heart has been condemned. It doesn't matter who I've told, what's in my heart is never quite enough. The people I have cared for most have shunned me in life and in love.
I'm a proud man, sometimes foolish.
I have a long way to go before I could ever be the man you need me to be.
And I got confused between what I should have done and what I thought was right.
I put you on a pedestal and then I knocked you down. It wasn't fair.
You were more a mother to my boys than they have ever known. You were more a woman to me than I have ever deserved.
You're not going to make this easy, are you?
I can live my life alone. I can raise my kids alone. I can walk this path alone. I'd much rather do it with you.
I think so... I don't know.
She's my best friend... or was.
You didn't marry your best friend?
I thought you had things all planned out.
It's not too late, you know?
Go Home, John. Go home and talk to your best friend the way you talk to me.
I need you to watch the boys.
Excuse us for a moment okay?
I can't believe you're a waitress.
I thought you liked my kids.
It's about me, the selfish prick.
Melanie, there is a grace about you that reminds me how clumsy I am.
I think my ten seconds are up.
If I give you my heart will you promise to treat it softly? Kiss it when it hurts? Put it in a box and know that it belongs to you?
I love you. I love you, I love you, I love you.
I had to find me first. I hope you plan on walking, cause I'm not sure I can carry you.

It's funny, the tricks the mind can play on you... but the Judge, he sat right over there... and the jury sat right there... and the audience was filled with all these people who didn't really give a shit about me.
And they all sat passing judgement on me, not knowing the situation, just staring over their schoolmarm spectacles and pointing their crooked fingers.
Zach? Are you ready? Mommy, can't be late again.
Come on baby. Don't do this to mommy. Not today.
Zach, do you want mommy to get fired?
If I get fired we won't have the money to go to Six Flags. Zach quickly dresses himself.
Lock your door. I'll be right back.
I don't want to talk about it.
Highly Effective Strategies of Time Management for the Single Parent?
It was written by a man... a married man.
Once upon a time, a very long time ago...
We do have a normal life... for us.
You'd could make a fortune with a Renta- Kid business.
I've often thought of renting mine.
For potty training. Give him something to aim at. Drop a Cheerio or two in the toilet and let him pee away.
I'm going to go talk to them for a little bit. I'll let you know.
I'm gonna talk to your dad.
We'll read another one in a little bit.
Not a knack really. It's just about finding hope in places there should be none.
No, he's going to be late. He has a date.
So, I guess you have to deal with me a little while longer.
Did you have a good time?
Quit trying so hard. You're forcing issues that can't be forced. Relax.
What's so important about that piece?
This is a surprise. Leave work to spend the day with us?
I'm all about second chances, but not when I come in second place.
Why was she here? What was that?
Mother? I've been more of a mother than she ever was.
Who willingly walked out of their lives.

What about Zach? How noble of you to be the only single parent in the world. How stoic you are... so concerned with the best interests of your children. Too bad. Their best interest is walking out the door.
Can I ask you a question? What is Phillip's favorite color?
Blue. His favorite color is blue.
Four. Two on top and two on bottom.
I'm more their mom than you'll ever be.
I don't think I've ever felt as much pity for anyone as I do for you right now.
You just don't get it do you?
You're here for you, you selfish prick.
Days go by when I lose me. There are nights when I lay in bed and I can hear Zach through the walls.
What? Not going to use them to try to persuade me with guilt?
I have a son of my own. I know when people are using their kids.
I can't believe you came here.
Beats chasing around after snot nosed brats all day.
So, what do the kids need? A babysitter? A surrogate mom?
I don't think I heard you.
As brutal as that can be?
I kind of like you too.
I never thought you'd make it.
I never thought you'd find me.
So, how do we do this? The two begin the ascent together.
So, this is where it all happened.
I don't want to go. Melanie hastily dresses her son.
I'm not thirteen. It's against the law to leave me alone in a car until I'm thirteen.
So many choices. A glance to her watch.
I don't want Coke. I want Sobe.
Why are you crying? Did I do something wrong?

Replies.Didascalie: (Pulling a book from an end table)

Replies.Reply: I know what you could do.
You could stay home with me.
If it keeps my mommy home with me.
When are we going to have a normal life.
I mean when are we going to be like other people?
You're too old for my mom.
That's okay, I don't have a dad.
... squandered opportunities. I, on the other hand, knew where I was going. I had that kind of drive, I just never had the talent.
I had priorities. I understood what it meant to have an attention span.
I was the King of Focus.
I'm just saying grow up. You can't keep drifting.
No Bueller, it's a decision. One you need to make. You can't keep running without direction. If you don't know where you're going you'll never get what you want.
They gave you purpose. But purpose, my friend, is not direction.
That's what I'm going to do.
In the grand scheme of things family is a liability, not an asset. Rick continues on.
Do you even know what you're doing or where you're going?
East leads nowhere, my friend. You should be heading south. The bar is south. East takes you places you don't want to go.
You have to instill a sense of direction at a very early age.
No, you have to mold them early. If you don't mold them they'll grow up to be Democrats.
That's not the point, is it, Carrie?
Whining about being single. Married men would kill to be in your situation!
You have your sons to raise without feminine interference. Do you understand the significance of your situation? Do you understand the power in your circumstance?
Men, all over the world, would kill for that kind of power.
You have the kids and she pays child support... and you sit here and whine about things being hard?
If you think you're in love you are.
Does your heart skip a beat when she walks by?
Does your heart skip a beat when she walks by?
Do your palms sweat when you think about her?
And have you ever told her this?
Have you ever told her this?
Loving your best friend confuses things? I can't think of a love more lucid. Rick stands to leave.
You know I'll never forgive you for this, don't you? You had the power and the dream at your fingertips and you're giving it all away.
Affairs of the heart and those of the mind are two different things.
The secret of life, Melanie, is to always pay attention...
... always be prepared for what's right around the corner. The CRACK of the bat.
It's the third time this week Mel.
If a person isn't responsible enough to be prompt to their job, they're not responsible enough to work for me.
You're fired Mel. Just get your things and go.
Too far away. Let's roost him.
Get em up. Up I said... up.
Oh, we got ourselves a litterbug here.
Shut him the hell up, Jimmy.
He's looking at me funny, Jimmy.
He's a twitcher... a twitcher and a talker. Boy, I tell you, if he'd twitched one more time I would've deposited large amounts of hot lead in his ass.
If we have to write the report I say I get to shoot him.
Can't I just wing him or something?
It's him... get him, get him, get him. They curb the car in front of Rick.
You know your rights, cretin, but just in case you don't...
You have the right to shut the hell up. Do you understand this right?
If you don't shut the hell up my partner might exercise his right to shoot you. Do you understand?
result in harm to your person. Do you understand this right?
Really? I don't think he is. Are you twitching boy?
You have the right not to twitch or shiver or make any other odd movements that might encourage my partner to discharge his weapon, do you understand?
What do we got here boys?
I'll take it from here boys.
No one's getting shot today, Bobby.
Jimmy; get him out of here.
You don't want to piss Bobby off.
Affirmative action. We have to hire our fair share of disabled ---
Take your time, Ma'am. We need you to be certain.
Turn to your left. The men follow their instruction.
All of you face forward. The two turn forward.
Number three take two steps forward.
Okay number three step back. Rick does as he's told.
Turn to your right --- all of you...
He has a brown ring on his collar.
He's afraid of the dark and cries himself to sleep at night saying his mommy doesn't love him.
I just... I just don't know...
Could you have him step forward?
I'm positive. That's the man that needs to be in custody.
Order in the court, I say.
Do you know why you're here today, Mr. Stevens?
You stand here today an accused man.
You have been placed in custody of your children.

I see no reason to extend this any further. Mr. Stevens you have been found competent by the State and by this Court. You are completely cognizant of your surroundings, and you leave me no choice. This court finds you guilty as charged.
You are hereby remanded to custody of your children for no less than a lifetime. This Court is adjourned.
If you can't do the time, Mr.
Order in this court! A beat as things quiet down.
Your inquiry, Mr. Stevens? Is it in the best interest of the children or in the best interest of you?
Then this court sees no reason to amend the original verdict. The order stands.
Your children, Mr. Stevens. You do realize you have children, don't you?
But nothing Mr. Stevens, either you have children or you don't.
So, you accept responsibility for bringing young life into the world?
There's no guessing, Mr. Stevens, either you're responsible for siring offspring or you aren't.
A crime of passion, Mr. Stevens?
Why are you here, Mr. Stevens? Why are you here? I'll tell you why you're here. Are you familiar with Ms. Cynthia Stevens?
Was your wife, Sir. Was your wife.
Well, she did. She also named you as her coconspirator in the act of having children. Were you aware of that, Mr. Stevens?
Mr. Stevens, you just told the court that you aware you had children. You have also admitted that Ms. Cynthia Stevens was, in fact, your wife.
Then why, Mr. Stevens, do you continue to deny culpability in this situation?
She picked you out of a lineup, Sir. What more do you need?
Time is not an option, Mr. Stevens.
You don't deny being married to Ms.
It's time to pay the piper, Mr.
She cut a deal, Rick. You were the one we wanted. You were the one we got. She took the plea. Sure, it costs her financially. But what is freedom worth?
What is so important Mr. Stevens that you would burden this court with convening today?
On what, Mr. Stevens? On what?
He doesn't know. He just doesn't know.
Tell it to someone who cares, Mr.
On top of that you told this court that you accepted the responsibility of having said children, did you not?

It seems to me, as it should to anyone with the capacity for simple deduction that you, Mr. Stevens, did willingly and knowingly enter into the commitments of parenthood fully aware of the potential pratfalls. Did you not?
Daddy, how come you're in jail?
When can we see you again?
Do that again and my daddy's going to kick your ass.
Daddy says I can do three things when I grow up.
I can go to college and move the hell out of his house. I can join the military and move the hell out of his house, or I can get a job and...
Well, I wanted that piece and Kris took that piece, and I really, really wanted that piece.
My daddy has a big pee-pee.
Please daddy? Please? Rick opens the book so all can see.
Daddy, I'm thirsty. Rick studies the climber for a moment.
I love her the whole universe.
I feel for you, I really do, but I've seen your kind before. You're a lifer. Whether it's fair or not.
You have visitors... in the courtyard.
I always knew you were a lifer.
If you leave don't ever come back.
Not even on a visit. You're a very ugly man. I'd hate to explain to the other guards why you'd come to visit me.
Quite the pickle you've got yourself in.
Boys will be boys. A NURSE peeks out.
What are you giving him money for?
I've never met a good father that couldn't support his kids.
You could watch the boys while he works.
No more excuses. It's time to live life and enjoy our grandkids.
Go. The boys will be fine.
She was no good for you. I knew it from the start.
You're dad and I are here for you.
Do you need anything? Food? Money?
Um... Yeah... okay... I suppose that would be all right... we'd have to ask your father, but I don't see why that would be a problem.
almost instantly. You can leave here, you know? Mary Ryan's son did.
What's to like? It's dingy and filthy. It's no place to raise children.
Mary Ryan's son thinks you're hiding.
No, but I think you should. I hate that woman. How can a mother abandon her kids? How could she do this to my babies?
I hope she's living in hell too.
What happened? Where is he? Is he going to be okay?
Just go. I'll watch these two.
Find a way. Everything happens for a reason. God doesn't abandon his children, and neither will you.
There are other things out there...
Oh... uh... well... I don't think your father is willing to do that.
What? My watching them while you were in there with Phillip wasn't enough? Make me feel guilty.
So, Phillip what do you want to be when you grow up?
And what are those? Phillip takes a deep breath.
To help him through the hard times.

I'm too old for that. The better side of life has passed me by. What if they fall? I don't hear like I used to. What if one of them was seriously hurt and I didn't hear their cry? I hate that the only thing I feel competent to do is give them money. I love my son and I love my grandbabies, but how would I live with myself if something happened to those children?
Can't we just give him money to pay for a baby-sitter?
I love you all the whole universe plus one.
Grandpa. Rick and his mother sit at a picnic table while the boys play with their grandfather.
Read it again. Read it again. Read it again.
Daddy! The boys run to their father. Melanie moves to Rick and gives him a kiss.
I'm really glad you could make it.
I want to see your boys.
I did not. I left them in the care of their loving father. There's a difference.
I just want to see the boys.
I know things can never go back to the way they were before.
Let's keep the attorneys out of this and settle things like civil adults.
I am who I am, Rick. I'm not cut out to be a mommy.
I had to give it a shot. Rick turns to walk away.
You are, and you wouldn't have it any other way.
So, why are you here with slick and not with "your" kids?
Yeah... yeah they do. Now if you'll excuse me I need to find the asparagus.
I couldn't do it, ya know?
I always thought I wanted to be a parent, and I was really good at being pregnant, but I sucked as a mom. I know that now. I don't have what it takes.
Take care of my boys... all of them.

So, needless to say, I understand your situation. My old lady, she took off and left me with the kids five years ago. That bitch. But I'm not bitter or anything. I found me a good day care and moved on with my life. You should too.
Of course it's hard, sometimes feels like you're in prison, but you gotta be a man... stand up for yourself... provide for your family.
Me? I'll put ya to work. Some long hours, but it all pays off. Keeps you off the welfare system if ya know what I mean.
I'd rather pay you than pay the government to pay you. You can start Monday.
Here's the number to the day-care.
So, how was your first week?
Don't spend it all in one place.
It's the American way. This country was founded on low paying, back breaking, long hour jobs. Why, work like this makes you a bona fide patriot. Ya gotta love it.
Where are you going? What will you do?
You'll never make it without me!
No, daddy, don't leave us here.
I'm sorry. It would be really nice to have you on board, but you're just a little too qualified.
I don't think I've seen such a perfect candidate.
Unfortunately we filled the position earlier today. WHIP PAN to cell doors slamming closed.
Mr. Stevens can you come back? The doctor could use your help in calming the child down.
Well, I need to give him a local so that I can sew the laceration, but he's not cooperating. Maybe hold his hand and distract him?

My son's a wuss. He cries over hangnails. My wife and I have tried everything to toughen him up, but nothing works. I was wondering if our kids could play together. Maybe some of Phillip's "boy" would rub off on Junior.
Yeah, Insurance. That thing that covers medical emergencies?
You're really funny... and kinda cute.
Go out sometime? I'd like that.
You're a single father? That's wonderful. So many men refuse to accept any responsibility for their kids. So, how many do you have?
That's amazing. I'm sure they're just angels.
My sister has three. She said when the second one was born it doubled the work. She didn't realize the third would double the work load would again. And to think you do it all by yourself.
You're a terrific man. Did I tell you I love kids? They love me. It just comes so instinctively even though I've never had kids myself.
A guy like you is so hard to find.
I think Rick is doing a wonderful job.
Excuse me, gentleman, I need to powder my nose.
You know Rick, someday some girl is going to realize what a good man you are.
Love isn't about money. Love is about truth and selflessness and discovering who you are and who'll be. Someday, someone will find you.
Kris, your brother has to go too.
You poor, poor man. You poor, poor children. How unfortunate to only have your father. How terrible it must be not to know your mother.
Sir, you're 3 months behind on your electric bill.
It's a start, but not nearly enough.
Because of their age it may take awhile. We'll start them out in foster care, but eventually they'll all be placed in loving, nurturing environments.
Mr. Stevens, I wish I could make that promise, but the odds of an adoptive family willing to take them all is astronomical.
He needs a father, not a book reading baby-sitter.
Use your mind and your heart. It's different than it ever should have been... but different isn't wrong.
Use what you have. There is a vein of wealth inside you just waiting to be mined. Think differently than you have ever thought before.
The answer lies within. Quit worrying about how these misguided events have torn your life apart.
Mr. Stevens, I can see you now.
Mr. Stevens? I can see you now.
I ain't some charity case. I know what you think when you look at me.
Think it's bad now? Wait til they're teenagers.
What's wrong? What did I do?
Long way down for that matter.
You know, if you stop here, halfway between a long way up and a long way down you really haven't accomplished much, have you?
That's what I said, fourteen years ago. Rick looks toward the top.
